q:
In Machine Learning, you are given the following mathematical equation. In this equation, the left-hand side defines the expected test MSE and refers to the average test MSE that you can obtain if you repeatedly estimated f using large number of training sets, and tested each at \(x_o\). 

Which of these statements represent this equation correctly?

Equation

\(E(y_o-\hat{f}(x_o))^2 = Var(\hat{f}(x_o))+[Bias(\hat{f}(x_o))]^2+Var(\in)\)

Statements

  1. The equation represents a relationship that if you want to minimize the expected test error, then you are required to select a statistical learning method that simultaneously achieves high variance and low bias.
  2. The equation represents a relationship that if you want to minimize the expected test error, then you are required to select a statistical learning method that simultaneously achieves low variance and high bias.
  3. The equation represents a relationship that if you want to minimize the expected test error, then you are required to select a statistical learning method that simultaneously achieves high variance and high bias.
  4. The equation represents a relationship that if you want to minimize the expected test error, then you are required to select a statistical learning method that simultaneously achieves low variance and low bias.

In Machine Learning, you are given the following three figures. Which of these set of statements about these figures is correct?

Figure 1

Figure 2

Figure 3

Statements

  1. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then remains constant after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is no change in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c) Figure 3—Boxplots displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.
  2. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then decreases after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is a slow but steady increase of approximately $ 10,000 in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c) Figure 3—Violin plot displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.
  3. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then decreases after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is an exponential increase of approximately $ 10,000 in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c) Figure 3—Boxplots displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.
  4. a) Figure 1—Wage as a function of Age. On average, wage increases with age until 60 years of age and then decreases after that point. 
    b) Figure 2—Wage as a function of Year. There is a flow but a steady increase of approximately $ 10,000 in the average wage between 2003 and 2009.
    c)Figure 3—Boxplots displaying Wage as a function of Education Level. On average, wage increase with the level of education.

You are given the following graphs:

  • Graph 1 represents a four-degree model on a training data
  • Graph 2 represents a four-degree model on a testing data

Which of these statements about the graphs is correct?

Graph 1

Graph 2

Statements

  1. Both graphs represent an overfit model.
  2. Both graphs represent an underfit model.
  3. The model represented in the graph fits the data correctly; it follows the training data and has learnt the relationship between x and y.
  4. Graph 1 represents overfitting, whereas graph 2 represents underfitting.

Which of the following statements about the inter-quantile range is correct:

  1. It is computed on the top 75% of observations after eliminating the highest and lowest observations. It is most affected by outliers.
  2. It is computed on the bottom 25% of observations after eliminating the highest and lowest observations. It is most affected by outliers.
  3. t is computed on the middle 50% of observations after eliminating the highest and lowest observations. It is least affected by outliers.
  4. It is computed on the middle 50% of observations after adding the highest and lowest observations. It is least affected by outliers.
In Machine Learning, you are given p variables in your dataset. Determine the number of distinct scatterplots that can be created in this scenario.

You are given the following two expressions. Which of these statements regarding these expressions is correct:

Expressions

  1. \(\frac{1}{n-1}\sum_{i}^{n}(x_i-\bar x)^2\)
  2. \(\sqrt(\frac{1}{n-1}\sum_{i}^{n}(x_i-\bar x)^2)\)

Statements

  1. The first expression represents variance denoted as \(\sigma\). The second expression represents standard deviation denoted as \(\sigma^2\).
  2. The first expression represents variance denoted as \(\sigma^2\). The second expression represents standard deviation denoted as \(\sigma\).
  3. The first expression represents standard deviation denoted as \(\bar X\). The second expression represents variance denoted as \(\sigma^2\).
  4. The first expression represents covariance denoted as \(\sigma^2\). The second expression represents standard deviation denoted as \(\sigma\).

The following graph represents the top five automobile companies with their expenditure on R&D (Research & Development) and the percentage of revenue spent on R&D(Research & Development) in 2017.

Which of the following companies has the 3rd highest revenue in 2017?

The following bar graph represents the exports of cotton (in million kilograms) made by different South Asian countries in a specific time period. What is the percentage increase in the exports of cotton made by Pakistan between 2014-15 and 2015-16?

The following pie chart represents the distribution of profit earned through the sales of Medtronic cardiovascular stents in the European countries in 2016-17.(Data points are in degrees)

If the overall profit was $16,10,230, then what is the overall profit earned through the sales of stents in Austria?

The following graph represents the revenue generated by a digital marketing company named DigiMagic by the selling two of its tools-CRM and Marketing Automation between years 2013-2017. What was the average revenue generated from CRM tool in the period 2013-17?

The following pie chart represents the distribution of profit earned through the sales of Medtronic cardiovascular stents in the European countries in 2016-17.(Data points are in degrees) If the overall profit was $16,10,230, then what approximate percentage of the profit from Italy constitutes the overall profit?

The following bar graph represents the exports of cotton (in million kilograms) made by different South Asian countries in the specific time period.

What is the percentage increase or decrease in the export of cotton made by Bhutan between 2014-15 and 2016-17?

The following pie charts represent the sales of different automobile companies in two consecutive years. If the total sales amount in 2016 is $52,000 million and the total sales amount in 2017 is $65,000 million, what was the sum of total sales of Fiago in 2016 and 2017?

The following pie charts represent the sales of different automobile companies in two consecutive years. If the total sales amount in 2016 is $52,000 million and the total sales amount in 2017 is $65,000 million, what was the approximate percentage increase in sales of GM between 2016 and 2017?

The following bar graph represents the sales of water bottles (in thousands of units) by different domestic companies in India between 2012-2017. Which of the following companies has the highest average annual sales volume?

The following bar graph represents the sales of water bottles (in thousands of units) by different domestic companies in India between 2012-2017. In which year the market share of Aqua Pura was the highest? (Market share=Total sales of company/Total sales of all the companies)

The following graph represents the revenue generated by a digital marketing company named DigiMagic by the selling two of its tools-CRM and Marketing Automation in the period 2013-2017. What was the percentage increase in the revenue generated from Marketing Automation tool between years 2013 to 2014?

The following graph represents the expenditure of the top five automobile companies on R&D (Research & Development) and the percentage of revenue spent on R&D (Research & Development) in 2017.

By what percentage is the revenue of General Motors more than that of Honda?
